pages.text: $(#9370DB)$(l)【Whisper of the Wind】$()$(br2)“Upon mountain peaks, waves of violet ripple in the breeze, murmuring distant dreams.”$(br2)Lavender’s slender flower spikes sway like drifting clouds, exuding a calming fragrance. Flourishing in high-altitude meadows, it is accustomed to standing tall against the wind. Mountain folk once regarded it as the messenger of the wind god, believing that those who wore a lavender wreath could hear whispers of the future carried by the breeze.

Thrives in alpine meadows and high-altitude biomes, resilient to cold and fond of wind. When in full bloom, entire valleys transform into vast oceans of purple, swaying gently with the currents of the air.

Excerpt from *The Traveler’s Memoirs*$(br)“A shepherd once told me that on the night lavender reaches full bloom, the sheep in the pasture run wild in their dreams—only to awaken at dawn, finding themselves miles away.”

Lavender flowers are slowly roasted, producing a tea as clear as the first light of dawn, with a faint sweetness upon the tongue. After drinking, footsteps feel lighter, as if the wind itself carries the drinker over the mountain ridges, and fate seems to smile a little more kindly.$(br2)$(#6A5ACD)But be warned—wind never blows in just one direction. Where luck leads, uncertainty follows…$()
